product_requests.description: A tool that allows users to prompt for their app's backend requirements and automatically builds and deploys the full backend stack on AWS infrastructure, connecting to their frontend application.
product_requests.pain_point: Existing backend solutions (like Supabase) can be slow or limited, and manually setting up a robust, scalable backend architecture on AWS is complex and time-consuming.

tweets.text:
Imagine there would exist a tool where you can prompt what your app is all about and it would build and deploy your full backend stack on aws using aws infra.

Connect it to your #lovable app and instead of slow supabase backend you get a real backend architecture on aws.

product_requests.description: A tool that identifies viral content (e.g., Reddit posts) within a specific niche, analyzes the reasons for its success, and assists users in rewriting or generating similar content tailored for their audience.
product_requests.pain_point: Difficulty in discovering effective content strategies, understanding what resonates with an audience, and efficiently creating engaging content that has a high chance of going viral.
product_requests.target_audience: Content creators, marketers, social media managers, community managers

tweets.text:
What if there was a tool that:

‚Äì Found the exact Reddit posts that went viral in your niche
‚Äì Broke down why they worked
‚Äì Helped you rewrite them for your audience

I‚Äôm building it.

Would you use it?

Building Scrapius- discover and validate SaaS ideas from real Reddit pain points.

Publicly, I have a landing page to see if there is interest, but its also a tool that I built for myself :)

https://t.co/h1H8TFJNTi

Here some details on how it works:

Scrapius, goes through a subreddit, looks through posts and sees if there is a potential product ideas, searches until it finds 5 potential ideas.

Then if an idea seems interesting, you can do a cross Reddit search to look in similar subreddits and their posts and see if there are conversations related to the idea.

Cross Reddit search give you a general sentiment analysis, extracted keywords, and a determination whether its worth pursuing or not (based on analysis).

If the idea is worth pursuing you can take it even further by doing an internet wide search and get signals for Market Size, Competition level, and pain points urgency, with evidence.

Save validated ideas that interest you in an idea bank, you can always reference to them.

Robust tool.

ni yo uso ideascraper!!  üòî

ayer estaba buscando en google: site:reddit. com "is there a tool for" + [nicho], abro el post , vuelvo a la busqueda.

eso es lo que tiene que hacer üß© ideascraper.
debeser un buscador de oportunidades...que ademas genera ideas https://t.co/UpG2Rh85bO

12. Still not sure what to build?

Here‚Äôs how to reverse engineer demand:

‚Üí Check Reddit pain points
‚Üí Use x/twitter search: ‚ÄúI wish there was a tool that‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Üí Browse G2/Trustpilot for SaaS complaints
‚Üí Spy on Gumroad bestsellers
‚Üí Find AI newsletters (eg. The Rundown) for trending tools
Then just ask: ‚ÄúCan I build a 10x better, faster, or cheaper version using AI?‚Äù

product_requests.description: A mobile application that uses a phone's camera to help users track and organize various physical items, including clothes, groceries, storage contents, collections, and garden items.
product_requests.pain_point: Manual and inefficient methods of keeping track of personal or small business inventory, leading to lost items, disorganization, and wasted time.
product_requests.target_audience: Individuals, small business owners, collectors, households

tweets.text:
Building a tool to help with keeping track of items such as cloths groceries, storage spaces,collections, wild life ,garden really will do allot.  All with your phone and camera.

Would love to bring on 1 or 2 more people to ship this.  Hit me up if you want more info.

product_requests.description: A GPS-integrated application designed for specific industries (e.g., construction, field services) that overlays and stores building plans, site plans, notes, and photos geographically for live use cases.
product_requests.pain_point: The need to use multiple disparate apps for site navigation, plan viewing, and data collection in the field, leading to inefficiency and lack of integrated information.
product_requests.target_audience: Construction professionals, field service technicians, insurance adjusters, site managers

tweets.text:
Wouldn‚Äôt it be cool to have active industry specific gps‚Ä¶ and site plan creation tools.

Tired of people asking me all the apps I use‚Ä¶ so I‚Äôm building the industry‚Äôs first gps that integrates actual building plans and other site plans into a live use case app. Meaning. 

Store information geographically and in the standard app directories. Leave notes, attach pics, all that. 

Storm work and insurance claims will benefit from this too but the day to day operations of TCi service businesses is my main target.

product_requests.description: A tool compatible with any language or build system that analyzes build processes to identify issues such as underutilized hardware, redundant compilations, and misconfigured targets, offering insights for optimization and build system transitions.
product_requests.pain_point: Slow and inefficient software build times, difficulty in diagnosing performance bottlenecks, and challenges in optimizing complex build systems across different languages and environments.
product_requests.target_audience: Software developers, DevOps engineers, build engineers

tweets.text:
Is a build profiling tool something that people would be interested in? I've been working on one for myself, and I'm trying to decide if it's worth making nice and releasing. 

Works on any language/build system. Checks for issues like under utilized hardware, files compiled multiple times, misconfigured targets... May eventually help you transition build systems.
@Sebasti66855537 Yeah nsight is generally the way to go for this kind of thing, or sometimes PIX. The only annoying part is having to do a build every time I make a change.
@asmah2107 Easy, enable merge queues, enforce caching, and throw more hardware at the problem. Buildkite is your friend

product_requests.description: A solution that helps job seekers prepare for interviews by clarifying vague job descriptions, identifying key company requirements, and managing multiple job applications efficiently.
product_requests.pain_point: Frustration with unclear job interview expectations, difficulty in tailoring responses to specific company needs, and the overwhelming process of tracking numerous job applications.

tweets.text:
I‚Äôm starting a new project. 

I'm calling it new but it's not actually a new one. It was just a tool I made for myself.

I came out with this project because It was time I was looking for a job and had difficulties preparing for my job interview.

The problem I found was that a lot of job interviews were unclear, with a bunch of keywords, and sometimes we don‚Äôt even understand the bottom of what the company is looking for.

+ When you are looking for a new job, you apply to many different jobs, so it‚Äôs hard to keep up.

So I'm coming up with the solutions for it !

product_requests.description: A platform that integrates and orchestrates various developer tools, reducing the 'paradox of choice' and providing a seamless, personalized environment for building production-grade software without vendor lock-in.
product_requests.pain_point: The overwhelming number of similar developer tools, minor differences leading to difficult choices, vendor lock-in, and the hassle of migrating between tools, causing decision fatigue and inefficiency.
product_requests.target_audience: Software developers, dev teams, engineering managers

tweets.text:
TIL no. 49: paradox of choice

there are way way way to many dev tools doing extremely similar things, advocating for minor differences, and desiring lock-in. 

building @withduckyAI has gone from a simple proof of concept that i thought i could whip up in a weekend to a headache in deciding what to build it with. 

now, its still a pretty simple idea and the architecture behind is relatively simple but that‚Äôs not what i learned, it‚Äôs that there are so many tools that implement these architectural patterns that make it difficult to truly pick one and build with it. 

i‚Äôm well aware of migrations and switching tools but that‚Äôs so much of a hassle. i just want one tool that does everything i want lol. i want personalized production grade software.

Too many AI tools, too many choices. 

We need one tool that just gives us the answer and figures out the best model behind the scenes.

Anyone building this?

product_requests.description: An open-source platform or thematic encyclopedia where developers and builders can share solutions, architectural ideas, project insights, and best practices to avoid reinventing the wheel and foster collaboration.
product_requests.pain_point: The 'closed' nature of the builder community, difficulty in finding shared knowledge or solutions to common problems, and the need for a centralized, accessible repository of practical information.
product_requests.target_audience: Developers, software engineers, indie hackers, open-source contributors

tweets.text:
The builder community is extremely closed individually. 
I regularly reach out to people and ask how they did x or y.
Just to get an idea how they solved their problems and I can tinker a bit or solve a similar problem for myself.

Out of all my approaches 0% have given any information. 

What are you afraid of?
@BerrryComputer @stinkycubert @decentricity build a berrry comptuer library outlining all builds, their original tweets, with category tags and ability to edit them
Yes. We need some kind of open source thematic encyclopedia: Share the outputs/results, browser incorporated. No need for everyone to have to reinvent the wheel every morning.

eh... I would love to already start building a small community of thinkers similar to myself, pursuing the perfect philosophy, but that would entail that there are such thinkers at all.

why can't I find you people, do you not exist? I am trying so hard to look, and yet...
@DionysianAgent we need an index website to scorge through peoples personal sites. How it always should have been

product_requests.description: An AI-driven tool that monitors project directories, analyzes project status (e.g., abandoned, near completion), automates follow-ups, assists in documentation (PRD generation), and streamlines task reviews to keep projects moving forward.
product_requests.pain_point: Manual and time-consuming project oversight, difficulty in tracking project progress, identifying stalled efforts, and automating routine development workflow tasks like documentation and review processes.
product_requests.target_audience: Software developers, project managers, indie hackers

tweets.text:
This got me thinking... How could I do something similar to start automating my stuff? 
What would it even do?

Some thoughts, besides basic content stuff... Monitor my projects directory and analyze all projects to get a status. Follow up with me to find out if they're abandoned or not, then move those out. Find those that are almost complete, and determine how to get them to that point quickly. Find those that have yet to be documented and ask questions to build out the prd. Send tasks for review, then start building when approved. Things would keep moving, and projects should hopefully start wrapping up.

product_requests.category: Real Estate Tech / AI Content Generation
product_requests.description: A tool that generates detailed and accurate property descriptions, including descriptive and content-wise information, solely from uploaded images of a property, with options for human review and editing.
product_requests.pain_point: The laborious and often inaccurate process of manually creating property descriptions, especially when relying heavily on visual information, and the need for efficient, high-quality content generation in real estate.
product_requests.target_audience: Real estate agents, property managers, real estate photographers, marketing professionals in real estate

tweets.text:
not yet, this is on the agenda, trying to figure out what market(s) I personally know best and can start in since it differs a lot. 

Main pain point from talking around seems to be the detailed property description, both internal and getting accurate information on the state of the property from both an descriptive but also content wise. 

main goal here is a complete prospect generated from images alone. with the ability for a human to review/edit.
